page.title: 03ELMSWELL RAILWAY STATION
page.content: This station was built in the mid-19th Century. There is a glass shelter, railway buildings (ticket office, waiting room etc.), a signal box, a level crossing, and a hut for the crossing keeper. Three men work at the station. The signal box is manually operated, so are the crossing gates. The men work in 8-jour shifts. We visited that station on a week-day, 20th. June 1985. There was a 24 hour time-table. Altogether 28 trains went towards Stowmarket - 10 goods trains and 18 passenger trains. One the same day 30 trains went towards Bury St. Edmunds - 10 goods trains and 20 passenge trains. 11 trains stopped at Elmswell.The signal box will be taken out in August 1985. The station will be run from Stowmarket using closed circuit television.
